lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Hey, kiddo. Hope you had a good break, cause it's gonna be a busy week for our little kiosk.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Since you've been away, the New European Union started offering a new form of digital ID.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: As you probably guessed, this means establishments like ours are gonna have to deal with this new Digital ID.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: Don't worry, I'll walk you through how it works. So shake off that hangover for a sec and pay attention.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: [Places SSI ID on counter] So here it is - this little sucker is called SSI. Self-Sovereign Identity or something like that.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: It's supposed to give you more control over your data, so I got myself one too. You'll see what I mean in a sec.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: So, for how it works... Say I'm a customer looking to buy some booze. You're gonna check my ID like usual. Go ahead and drag this over to the ID reader.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: [SSI Displays on screen, pending access to info] See the interface screen? That's where you'll see the ID holder's info. You might've noticed that my info is blocked out right now.

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: That's cause the ID I gave you was SSI, so you need to ask me for access to the information you need from me before you can see it. Other ID's just show you all my info like usual.

responses.responseText: What's that I meant by having more control of your data with SSI?

lines.speaker: Emma
lines.text: It means I get to decide what you see. If you need my DOB to check my age, you ask, and I can grant access just to that field, not my address or name. It's all about selective disclosure.
